title: School District of Reedsburg
text:
The School District of Reedsburg is a <a href="school%20district">school district</a> based in the city of <a href="Reedsburg%2C%20Wisconsin">Reedsburg</a>, <a href="Wisconsin">Wisconsin</a>.
Covering approximately 264 square miles, the district serves the city of Reedsburg and the villages of <a href="Ironton%2C%20Wisconsin">Ironton</a>, <a href="La%20Valle%2C%20Wisconsin">LaValle</a>, <a href="Loganville%2C%20Wisconsin">Loganville</a>, and <a href="Rock%20Springs%2C%20Wisconsin">Rock Springs</a>. The district administers 4 elementary schools, one intermediate school, one middle school, and one high school. It has an enrollment of over 2,800 students, and a graduation rate of 94.3%. The district operates with a $32 million budget.
Grounds.
The School District of Reedsburg owns two forests in <a href="Sauk%20County%2C%20Wisconsin">Sauk County</a>: the Hartje Outdoor Learning Center and the Romoren School Forest. The District also oversees 129 acres of sports fields, lawn space, walking trails, and parking lots.
History.
2017 referendum.
Should the School District of Reedsburg be allowed to exceed $32,000,000 for the cost of a new elementary school, a new transportation facility, and building renovations for Reedsburg Area High School, Webb Middle School, Ironton-LaValle, Loganville, Pineview, and Westside Elementary School?
COVID-19 pandemic.
On 13 March 2020, Governor <a href="Tony%20Evers">Tony Evers</a> mandated the closure of all Wisconsin schools until 6 April. The school district followed the governor's order, and all schools were close immediately. <a href="Distance%20education">Distance education</a> was used for the remainder of the 2019–2020 school year, ending on 22 May, earlier than originally scheduled.
